intro: Korthalsia echinometra, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. The fruit is a legume, containing several seeds that are dispersed by wind or animals.
